page.title: 14 Fire Service (cont.)
page.content: The Firemen have to live very locally,within two miles of the station,so that they can get to the engine quickly in an emergency.They have local jobs such as milkman, mechanic, shop assistant etc.The station has had some very unusual calls such as a cow in a cess pit and a horse in a swimming pool! On July 12th.1985,the local firemen were joined by men from the large stations in nearby towns to fight a fire which broke out in historic Missenden Abbey. The building, which is owned by Bucks. County Council, has been used for courses of various kinds.A large new development has almost been completed and the old building was about to be modernised when disaster struck.The interior has been gutted and the damage has been estimated to be a million pounds.
